note.note-paragraph: In this subclass, the following term is used with the meaning indicated:"luggage" means containers for personal belongings for a journey, e.g. travelling bags, suitcases, trunks.

In this subclass, the following terms are used with the meaning indicated:"flexible" means providing a structure with no considerable resistance against deformation or decrease of the enclosed volume, whereby a two-dimensional stability may be provided, e.g. by a stiffened bottom"semi-rigid" means providing a structure with three-dimensional stability in an unloaded state and resilient resistance against deformation, or allowing a limited decrease, of the enclosed volume, e.g. by a resilient frame or a rigid frame with flexible side walls"rigid" means providing a structure with three-dimensional stability allowing no deformation leading to a considerable decrease of the enclosed volume"collapsible" means providing a feature other than use of flexible material for reducing the dimensions of flexible luggage or the enclosed volume of semi-rigid or rigid luggage"extensible" means providing a feature other than use of flexible material for increasing the enclosed volume of flexible, semi-rigid or rigid luggage
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

reference.text: collapsible or extensible A45C7/00; convertible into other articles A45C9/00

CPC-specific-text.text: releasably fitted to a button or clothing item
fitted in handbags or the like
combined with key rings or the like

title-part.text: Purses to be worn at the belt or bracelet

CPC-specific-text.text: devices for the prevention of theft or loss of wallets A45C13/185
with additional compartments for storing other kinds of objects

title-part.text: Money-bags for conductors or like people

CPC-specific-text.text: with means for carrying on the body
with one or more recesses for receiving a coin, i.e. each recess receiving one single coin
with one or more recesses for receiving coins, i.e. the coins being stored side by side in a single recess, e.g. groove with coins flat in one planar surface
with coins stored in piles, i.e. several coins stacked in a compartment
with means for controlling the dispensing of coins, e.g. followers, pushers or selectors
Treat collecting devices, e.g. bags for collecting contributions

reference.text: collapsible or extensible luggage, bags or the like A45C7/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Bags having two volumes connected at upper ends, e.g. saddle bags

title-part.text: Handbags provided with removable or washable covers

reference.text: collapsible or extensible luggage, bags or the like A45C7/00

CPC-specific-text.text: semi-rigid, i.e. resistant against deformation and resilient, e.g. with a resilient frame
soft-sided, i.e. with flexible side walls covering a rigid frame
with a hard shell, i.e. rigid shell as volume creating element
the rolling means being formed by the trunk itself
with spherical rolling means, e.g. ball casters
with immobilising means, e.g. means for blocking the wheels
Other arrangements of the rolling means
convertible into an open planar surface, e.g. a sheet
with an elongated shape, i.e. belt-shaped
with fasteners along the periphery of the surface
collapsible to a minimal configuration, e.g. for storage purposes
comprising a plurality of separable elements which can be used independently of one another
with interchangeable elements forming the storage space, e.g. modular
comprising a plurality of hinged panels to be unfolded in one plane for access purposes
collapsible to a minimal configuration, e.g. for storage purposes
comprising a plurality of separable elements which can be used independently of one another
with interchangeable elements forming the storage space, e.g. modular
comprising a plurality of hinged panels to be unfolded in one plane for access purposes

title-part.text: Luggage or bags convertible into objects for other use

reference.text: sacks or packs carried on the body and convertible into other articles A45F4/02; trunk-wardrobes A47B61/06; trunk-beds A47C17/82

CPC-specific-text.text: into other hand or travelling articles

title-part.text: Receptacles for purposes not provided for in groups A45C1/00 - A45C9/00

reference.text: specially adapted for toilet or cosmetic equipment A45D29/20, A45D44/18; travelling sewing kits A45F3/48

CPC-specific-text.text: for portable audio devices, e.g. headphones or MP3-players
for portable handheld communication devices, e.g. mobile phone, pager, beeper, PDA, smart phone
for portable computing devices, e.g. laptop, tablet, netbook, game boy, navigation system, calculator
for storing a plurality of disposable lens packages
Receptacles for personal medical or care products, e.g. drugs, condoms or patches; Small first-aid kits

title-part.text: Making of spectacle or pince-nez cases
Watch cases or guards, with or without windows

CPC-specific-text.text: with a reminding device, e.g. when the card is not returned into its holder
with protection from unauthorised reading by remotely readable data carriers
Media card holders, e.g. memory cards, SIM cards

title-part.text: Lunch or picnic boxes or the like
Watertight containers for use while swimming
Etuis for purposes not covered by a single one of groups A45C11/02 - A45C11/22, A45C11/26, A45C11/32 - A45C11/38
Roll-up holders with pockets for separate articles
Bags or wallets for holding keys

CPC-specific-text.text: Sheath-like bags for protecting a key-blade or for receiving a key
comprising flexible ties, e.g. strips, bands or chains

title-part.text: Cases for drawing or like instruments
Camera cases, e.g. of ever-ready type

CPC-specific-text.text: Expanding devices for display purposes, e.g. filler for soft luggage
for holding portable computers or accessories therefor
for holding or compacting items by creating vacuum

title-part.text: Decorative devices for handbags or purses

CPC-specific-text.text: with two parallel resilient strips, hinged at their ends and opened by pressure in longitudinal direction on both ends
with elongated profiles fastened by sliders

title-part.text: Devices to prevent theft or loss of

reference.text: separate handles for carrying means A45F5/10

title-part.text: Devices for sound-producing, piercing, gas-discharging, or the like

the handle being slidable, extractable and lockable in one or more positions

title-part.text: Combinations of handles with other devices

CPC-specific-text.text: with strap loop for carrying an object by passing the hand through the loop, the loop resting partially around the wrist
for attaching auxiliary articles to luggage, e.g. piggyback

title-part.text: Stays or supports for holding lids or covers open

CPC-specific-text.text: with automatic opening or closing means

title-part.text: Reinforcements for edges, corners, or other parts

reference.text: trunks with built-in rolling means A45C5/14

title-part.text: Umbrella, stick, or glove holders attached to a bag
Purses, bags, luggage or other receptacles covered by groups A45C1/00 - A45C11/00, combined with other
Details not otherwise provided for in A45C
Means for indicating features of the content from outside
Articles convertible into a stand, e.g. for displaying purposes
